page.title: 09Typical day,Agnes,Scilly
page.content: If the sun is shining and there is not too much wind,I get up quite early, (7-30) In order to start the day's baking.Sometimes in the middle of summer,there can be about 500 visitors who come from the other neighbouring Islands.I put the "Aga" on high and start making chocolate sponges and barmbrack.As soon as the "Aga" is hot enough the scones and lastly the bread rolls are cooked.I open at 10-30 every morning,and close at 5-00.Throughout the day people are coming in for morning coffees and cakes,then from 12-2 I serve lunches.After 2pm ,nearly everyone wants a cream tea.Gradually by about 4-30 they are all making their way back home.Then I have to start all over again for another day.Then it is tea-time for the family.After that I play the piano or read.
